intro: Eriocaulon planifolium, commonly known as the flat-leaf spikerush, is a member of the Cyperaceae family. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its grass-like appearance and compact growth habit. The plant typically grows in wet or seasonally flooded habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas. Its leaves are flat and linear, often arranged in a dense rosette, while its inflorescence consists of a spike of small, three-lobed flowers. Eriocaulon planifolium plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms.
